terrains.name: Water
terrains.desc: Large bodies of liquid water such as oceans, lakes, and rivers. Generally impassable without naval or aerial units.

terrains.name: Grassland
terrains.desc: Open areas dominated by grasses and small shrubs. Ideal for agriculture or settlements due to moderate fertility.

terrains.name: Forest
terrains.desc: Dense woodland regions rich in biodiversity. Slows movement and provides resources such as timber.

terrains.name: Desert
terrains.desc: Arid terrain with minimal vegetation and extreme temperature variations. Difficult for agriculture and habitation.

terrains.name: Mountain
terrains.desc: High-relief terrain with steep slopes and rocky surfaces. Generally cold, rugged, and low in fertility.

terrains.name: Tundra
terrains.desc: Cold, treeless regions with permafrost and low-growing vegetation. Limited biodiversity and slow ecological processes.
